snippet: Flight restrictions underestimated the risks to a startling degree, leaving Flight 17 exposed at 33,000 feet to missiles known to fly to more than twice that height.
abstract: Precautions instituted by aviation authorities and flight planners to protect commercial aviation along Russian-Ukrainian border have been shown to be catastrophically insufficient by downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17; decisions by Ukrainian and Russian officials to restrict airspace, rather than close it completely, raise unanswered questions.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER, C. J. CHIVERS and NICOLA CLARK
byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher reported from Kuala Lumpur, C. J. Chivers from the United States, and Nicola Clark from Paris. Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from New York, and Neil MacFarquhar and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Flight restrictions underestimated the risks to a startling degree, leaving Flight 17 exposed at 33,000 feet to missiles known to fly to more than twice that height.

headline.main: Downing of Jet Exposes Defects of Flight Precautions Over Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Downing of Jet Exposes Defects of Flight Precautions Over Ukraine
